page.title: 13PRINTING THE NEWS,WITHERNSEA
page.content: News for the local paper,the Holderness Gazette,is obtained in various ways.People telephone or call in at the office.Sometimes other daily papers might be consulted for items.Stories are edited and investigated before being sent for printing.Requests for adverts from businessmen or private people must be received by Tuesday for inclusion in Thursday's paper.When items are ready for printing they are sent to the printers, a small firm, serving the whole area.They have only 6 staff very modern equipment.News is typed onto a word processor and together with the ads, columns are pieced together to fill the pages.Photographs are copied on a special camera which can decrease or increase size.The paper was first published in 1960 but is now tremendously increased in size.
